column4: race

text: I implore every dude reading this to seriously reconsider what you feel is appropriate behavior with the opposite sex
out of respect for the women who came forward
column4: and all the women in your feed posting "me too"

text: & it's not just from trolls online
column4: it's from people that I love and otherwise respect in real life!

text: I can't tell you how often I hear things like "he's a good guy
column4: I know he couldn't have done something like that."

text: what if no one believes you? what if coming forward means opening yourself up to hate and ridicule and further trauma?
if the person who assaulted you is married/has kids - what if coming forward means breaking up a marriage? A family?
the deck is completely stacked against you
column4: and forces you to constantly consider whether telling the truth is "worth it"

text: So far
column4: I have not been brave enough to do it.

text: speaking out about sexual assault
column4: especially in the form of calling out your abuser
